abstract: The board decided that it would keep its European subsidiary, rather than sell a 55 percent stake in it to the Canadian car parts maker Magna International and Sberbank of Russia.
snippet: The board decided that it would keep its European subsidiary, rather than sell a 55 percent stake in it to the Canadian car parts maker Magna International and Sberbank of Russia.
lead_paragraph: Update | 5:57 p.m. The new board of General Motors reversed course late Tuesday afternoon on the anticipated sale of the Opel division in Europe and decided that G.M. would retain the business and restructure Opel itself.

headline.main: G.M. Decides to Keep Opel Instead of Selling It
